subsc: General industry and trade sector,Non-compulsory pensions and insurance,Banking,Law and justice,Central government administration

abstracts.cdata!:
This Structural Adjustment Credit aims
            at: 1) improving public finance management, settling the
            domestic debt; and 2) restructuring the financial sector.
            The public finance component will enhance fiscal revenues
            through reduction of exemptions and improved tax
            administration, and incorporate improvements in the tax and
            incentive system that will encourage environmentally
            sustainable growth and resource use. Budgetary expenditures
            on priority development sectors (health, education,
            agriculture, road maintenance, tax administration, and
            justice) will rise. Civil service reform will increase both
            its efficiency and the quality of public services. The
            financial sector component will reform the regulatory
            framework and restructure key banks and insurance companies.
            A revised institutional framework will support an
            acceleration of the privatization program. Public
            enterprises will be required to operate with hard budget
            constraints. Finally, continued regulatory reform will
            improve the business environment.
